column1: Public Service Announcement (Interlude),This is a public survice announcement sponsored by Just blaze and the good folks at Roc-A-Fella Records.[
column2: ]Fellow Americans, It is with the upmost pride and sincerity that i present this recording as a militestament and recollection of history in the making during our generation.[
column4: ]Allow me to re-introduce myself, My name is HOV[

column1: Public Service Announcement,[Intro: Jay-Z and voiceover][
column3: ]Sponsored by Just Blaze and the good folks at Roc-A-Fella Records[
column4: ]"Fellow Americans, it is with the utmost pride and sincerity[
column5: ]that I present this recording, as a living testiment and recollection[
column6: ]of history in the making during our generation."[
column7: ][Verse 1][
column8: ]Allow me to re-introduce myself[
column9: ]My name is Hov', OH, H-to-the-O-V[
column10: ]I used to move snowflakes by the O-Z[

column15: ]Flyer than a piece of paper bearin my name[
column16: ]Got the hottest chick in the game wearin my chain, that's right[
column17: ]Hov', OH - not D.O.C.[
column18: ]But similar to them letters, "No One Can Do it Better"[
column19: ]I check cheddar like a food inspector[
column20: ]My homey Strict told me, "Dude finish your breakfast"[
column21: ]So that's what I'ma do, take you back to the dude with the Lexus,[
column22: ]fast-forward the jewels and the necklace[
column23: ]Let me tell you dudes what I do to protect this[
column24: ]I shoot at you actors like movie directors {*laughing*}[
column25: ]This ain't a movie, dog! (oh shit)[
column26: ][Interlude: voice-over][
column27: ]"Now before I finish, let me just say[
column28: ]I did not come here to show out, did not come here to impress you[
column29: ]Because to tell you the truth when I leave here I'm GONE![
column30: ]And I don't care WHAT you think about me - but just remember,[
column31: ]when it hits the fan brother, whether it's next year, ten years,[
column32: ]twenty years from now, you're gonna be able to say[
column33: ]that these brothers lied to you JACK!"[

column1: Death Of Autotune,
December 4th,[Intro: Gloria Carter][
column3: ]Weighing in at ten pounds, eight ounces[
column4: ]He was the last of my four children[
column5: ]The only one who didn't give me any pain, when I gave birth to him[
column6: ]And that's how I knew, that he was a special child[
column7: ]"Hi baby, what's wrong? You look like, you've lost your best friend[
column8: ]Tell me, is it something that I've done again?[
column9: ]You look like, you've lost your best friend[
column10: ]Tell me."[
column11: ][Verse One: Jay-Z][
column12: ]They say they never really miss you 'til you dead or you gone[
column13: ]So on that note I'm leavin after this song[
column14: ]See you ain't gotta feel no way about Jay so long[
column15: ]At least let me tell you why I'm this way, hold on[
column16: ]I was conceived by Gloria Carter and Adnus Reeves[
column17: ]Who made love under the sycamore tree[
column18: ]Which makes me, a more sicker MC and my momma would claim[
column19: ]At ten pounds when I was born I didn't give her no pain[
column20: ]Although through the years I gave her her fair share[
column21: ]I gave her her first real scare, I made up for birth when I got here[
column22: ]She knows my purpose was on purpose, I ain't perfect, I care[
column23: ]But I feel worthless cause my shirts wasn't matchin my gear[
column24: ]Now I'm just scratchin the surface cause what's buried under there[
column25: ]Was a kid torn apart once his pop disappeared[

column1: Interlude (in The Black Album),"And the other night when I was, researching, what we were going to be discussing today, I came across a passage that, I think it really exemplifies what the young brother next to me was talking about, and that all things must come to an end.[
column2: ]It is an inevitable part of the cycle of existence.[
column4: ]Take the analogy of a tree that grows in Brooklyn, among the steel and concrete with all of its glorious branches and leaves.[
column5: ]One day he too will pass on his legacy, through the seeds that drop to the ground.[
column6: ]And as the wind carry these seeds throughout the land, a new life will begin for each one of them as they stand for a monument to the one that came before."

column1: Pray,[Beyoncé][
column2: ]Deliver me from my enemies, O' God.[

column5: ]Save me from the brethren.[

column28: ]We can never be sure so all we can do is[

column34: ]Pray for me![

column36: ]As I head to my homeroom, I observe the rooms:[
column37: ]Dope needles on the ground.[

column39: ]As the girls start to giggle, I ask, "Why you laugh?"[
column40: ]They say, "You too little.[
column41: ]One day you'll understand.[
column42: ]One day you'll become a man, buy things you have to get you."[
column43: ]Fast-forward, freeze frame: I'm a pistol.[
column44: ]Fist full of dollars — ignorance is so blissful.[

column46: ]Around here is the shit that you just do.[
column47: ]I just left school.[

column49: ]They have their guns drawn screamin',[
column50: ]"Just move unless there's something else you suggest we can do."[
column51: ]He made his way to the trunk, opened it like,[

column1: Renagade,Motherfuckers -[
column2: ]say that I'm foolish I only talk about jewels[
column3: ]Do you fools listen to music or do you just skim through it?[
column4: ]See I'm influenced by the ghetto you ruined[
column5: ]That same dude you gave nothin, I made somethin doin[
column6: ]what I do through and through and[
column7: ]I give you the news - with a twist it's just his ghetto point-of-view[
column8: ]The Renegade; you been afraid[
column9: ]I penetrate pop culture, bring 'em a lot closer to the block where they[
column10: ]pop toasters, and they live with they moms[
column11: ]Got dropped roasters, from botched robberies niggaz crotched over[
column12: ]Mommy's knocked up cause she wasn't watched over[
column13: ]Knocked down by some clown when child support knocked[
column14: ]No he's not around - now how that sound to ya, jot it down[
column15: ]I bring it through the ghetto without ridin 'round[
column16: ]hidin down duckin strays from frustrated youths stuck in they ways[
column17: ]Just read a magazine that fucked up my day[
column18: ]How you rate music that thugs with nothin relate to it?[
column19: ]I help them see they way through it - not you[
column20: ]Can't step in my pants, can't walk in my shoes[
column21: ]Bet everything you worth; you lose your tie and your shirt[
column22: ]Since I'm in a position to talk to these kids and they listen[
column23: ]I ain't no politician but I'll kick it with 'em a minute[
column24: ]Cause see they call me a menace; and if the shoe fits I'll wear it[
column25: ]But if it don't, then y'all'll swallow the truth grin and bear it[
column26: ]Who could inherit the title, put the youth in hysterics[
column27: ]Usin his music to steer it, sharin his views and his merits[
column28: ]But there's a huge interference - they're sayin you shouldn't hear it[
column29: ]Maybe it's hatred I spew, maybe it's food for the spirit[
column30: ]Maybe it's beautiful music I made for you to just cherish[
column31: ]But I'm debated disputed hated and viewed in America[
column32: ]as a motherfuckin drug addict - like you didn't experiment?[
column33: ]Now now, that's when you start to stare at who's in the mirror[
column34: ]and see yourself as a kid again, and you get embarrased[
column35: ]And I got nothin to do but make you look stupid as parents[
column36: ]You fuckin do-gooders - too bad you couldn't do good at marriage![
column37: ](Ha ha!) And do you have any clue what I had to do to get here I don't[
column38: ]think you do so stay tuned and keep your ears glued to the stereo[
column39: ]Cause here we go - he's[
column40: ]And I'm the sinister, Mr. Kiss-My-Ass it's just the[
column41: ]Renegade! Never been afraid to say[
column42: ]what's on my mind at, any given time of day[
column43: ]Cause I'm a Renegade! Never been afraid to talk[
column44: ]about anything (ANYTHING) anything (ANYTHING), Renegade![
column45: ]Never been afraid to say[
column46: ]what's on my mind at, any given time of day[
column47: ]Cause I'm a {Renegade} Never been afraid to holler[
column48: ]about anything {anything?} Anything {ANYTHING!}[
column49: ]I had to hustle, my back to the wall, ashy knuckles[
column50: ]Pockets filled with a lot of lint, not a cent[
column51: ]Gotta vent, lot of innocent of lives lost on the project bench[
column52: ]Whatchu hollerin? Gotta pay rent, bring dollars in[
column53: ]By the bodega, iron under my coat, feelin braver[
column54: ]Doo-rag wrappin my waves up, pockets full of hope[
column55: ]Do not step to me - I'm awkward, I box leftier often[
column56: ]My pops left me an orphan, my momma wasn't home[
column57: ]Could not stress to me I wasn't grown; 'specially on nights[
column58: ]I brought somethin home to quiet the stomach rumblings[
column59: ]My demeanor - thirty years my senior[
column60: ]My childhood didn't mean much, only raisin green up[
column61: ]Raisin my fingers to critics; raisin my head to the sky[
column62: ]Big I did it - multi before I die (nigga)[
column63: ]No lie, just know I chose my own fate[
column64: ]I drove by the fork in the road and went straight[
column65: ]See I'm a poet to some, a regular modern day Shakespeare[
column66: ]Jesus Christ the King of these Latter Day Saints here[
column67: ]To shatter the picture in which of that as they paint me[
column68: ]as a monger of hate and Satan a scatter-brained atheist[
column69: ]But that ain't the case, see it's a matter of taste[
column70: ]We as a people decide if Shady's as bad as they say he is[
column71: ]Or is he the latter - a gateway to escape?[
column72: ]Media scapegoat, who they can be mad at today[
column73: ]See it's easy as cake, simple as whistlin Dixie[
column74: ]while I'm wavin the pistol at sixty Christians against me[
column75: ]Go to war with the Mormons, take a bath with the Catholics[
column76: ]in holy water - no wonder they try to hold me under longer[
column77: ]I'm a motherfuckin spiteful, DELIGHTFUL eyeful[
column78: ]The new Ice Cube - motherfuckers HATE to like you[
column79: ]What did I do? (huh?) I'm just a kid from the gutter[
column80: ]makin this butter off these bloodsuckers, cause I'm a muh'fuckin[
column81: ]- repeat 345X jay z greatest rapper alive sucka[
column82: ](sorry to tell you but eminem murdered him on this track; R.I.P jay z)
